intro: Peponidium tamatavense, commonly known as the Tamatave moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, gourds, and melons. The plant produces small, green, oval fruits that turn yellow when mature. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
